website_summaries.verdict: The Focal Sphear is a relatively affordable audiophile-grade in-ear headphone that's easy to listen to for long stretches.
pros: The Focal Sphear is a lightweight, comfortable in-ear headphone that stays in your ears and sounds impressive for the price, with full bass and pleasantly crisp treble
There's an inline one-button remote and microphone for cell phone use and a carry case is included
cons: They let in a little more ambient noise than your typical noise-isolating headphone and the headphone's added transparency magnifies the flaws in poorly produced tracks or heavily compressed recordings

website_summaries.verdict: The no-frills Focal Sphear in-canal earphones deliver a secure fit and a balanced sound signature that still allows for some added bass depth.
pros: Clean, powerful audio performance with robust bass and bright highs
Ships with multiple eartip options, including memory foam tips
cons: Could use a bit more high-mid presence

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, minimal isolation
customer_reviews.text: The sound is very good if not a little bright. I found it difficult to get a good fit with the supplied foam and silicone tips as the driver is quite large and the plugs aren't long enough for my ears. I used the plugs from my old Grado earphones and they fit well and the phones are very comfortable. There is very little noise isolation which may or may not be important to some.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. J. Mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic earphones
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic earphones at very reasonable cost. I could call them audiophile. Thy have deep, but no hanging, structurally complex bass that do not bleed to the midrange. Crispy top end, very detailed, but never harsh. There is lots of instrument definition and separation, air. But the biggest surprise is the midrange. It is smooth, lucid with proper instrumental timbre. It' s so hard to fault and dislike the quality of the earphones. They are easy to drive with your mobile phone, average dap or standalone headphone amplifier, with better quality source every step is improved. Amazing earphones and highly recommended !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maciej

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are well made, and sound great! I was so surprised by the definition in the mid and treble. Great fit, and came with quite a few accessories. I use them with a small headphone amp to tame a bit the treble, which can be a tinge too prononced to my taste, without being ever sibilant, and this works really well. My favourite iem to go out and about, at a great price. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice detail; wish: more bottom end
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace a pair of Bose TriPort earbuds that Bose no longer makes and I wanted something non-battery and non-noise cancelling as I use them for backpacking. I bought these Focal Spear-S because they met those requirements and I have heard Focal speakers before and really like them. So, was disappointed in the low end (using Ipod Shuffle 4th generation), but impressed with the detail via my FiiO X5.
customer_reviews.author: World Famous Initials

customer_reviews.title: Remote doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is decent but the remote doesn't work properly every time (sometimes the start/stop doesn't work) and there's no volume on the remote control which is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Mobsby

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable and good-quality earphones
customer_reviews.text: Item was received in perfect condition, packed well with an air bag to secure the item. Earphones were just like other reviews mentioned; very comfortable even when worn for long hours. The button control would've been better with volume toggler but that's just one minor gripe. The build feels good though i must say i thought the earphones were smaller; the driver and buttons seemed to be larger than pictured in focal's official photos. Great product overall!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Sound gift
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for boyfriend who always needs headphones, hopefully these will last. He says the sound quality is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous headset
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and comfortable to wear. Expensive but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Graet sound and holds very well in ears
customer_reviews.text: Great deep sounds I usually have problems with in ear headset that would never hold properly. This one is perfect, the plugs are in a material and shape that holds very well and properly isolates from noisy environment.
customer_reviews.author: Goldie

customer_reviews.title: Really nice pair.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. In my opinion better than Sennheiser momentum I2 IEG, V-Moda ZN, soundmagic e80, 1more e1001. But i still miss my Mdr650 from Sony, best value.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones! Coupled with small sound key dac the sound quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: timtom

customer_reviews.title: perhaps the best in ear headphones I used so far
customer_reviews.text: For this price range, perhaps the best in ear headphones I used so far.
customer_reviews.author: pesoso

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For a "normal" music listener these headphones are excellent, with detailed sound and very confortable. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Maia

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: Would give this five stars for sound and build quality (both excellent and a real step up from the earphones I had used previously in the £30-40 range) but I've had to knock one star off because of the significant sound bleed. So it depends how much of an issue that is for you (ie whether you expect to spend a lot of time listening to the in libraries or quiet offices).
customer_reviews.author: Alpago

customer_reviews.title: Good but not as good as I was expecting - ...
customer_reviews.text: Good but not as good as I was expecting - smooth but a little light in the bass and not very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: andyc

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality. Faulty after a couple weeks. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Sounded great initially but within a couple weeks the volume on one side dropped to almost nil. Returned for exchange but Focal not honouring because I don't still have the original box.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus Blooter

customer_reviews.title: excellent soundstage, balance sound
customer_reviews.text: Focal Sphear -Detailed,dynamic,bright and punchy bass Bowers and wilikins C5 series 2 - detailed, laid back sound,lots of bass Bang and olufsen h3 2nd gen -Detailed, high mid/vocal presence, decent bass 1more Quad driver - Detailed, excellent soundstage, balance sound, clarity is the best, best sounding of the 4 Sound 1more Quad > B&O H3 > Focal Sphear >B&W C5 Comfort B&O H3 > Focal Sphear > 1more Quad > B&W C5
customer_reviews.author: Jocarl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ear bud
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, weight, and quality sound. These don't color playback much, a very natural almost flat sound stage (like say the HD600 open back headphones would offer). A little harsh at the highest frequencies, most notable at higher volumes. These aren't completely sealed, so while I was able to use them on a plane I could still quite a bit of ambient sound intruding. The tips aren't a common size, I found the Comply 160 (size M) fits and feel as good as the originals. With heavy use I was replacing tips every 1-2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous#1337

customer_reviews.title: Check your phone if you are disappointed with performance.
customer_reviews.text: If you order these and find them lacking, try an external DAC. My Samsung S7 Edge phone has a terrible DAC both in quality and volume potential. At first I thought these were dull and lifeless as any other earbud (but not bad like cheapy $10 earbuds). Then I used a different DAC and found these to be delightful. For the price, these sound just right. I knew my S7 was weak, but I didn't know how low quality it was until I tried the external DAC (I am just using a cheap one too, not an expensive DAC).
customer_reviews.author: Brody

customer_reviews.title: My favorite earbuds of a comparison test - now my daily drivers
customer_reviews.text: I have these inserted into my head most of the day - every day. They're extremely comfortable and they sound really good. Impressive low-end punch and good overall full range sound. These are far superior to nearly every pair of earbuds that I have tried over the years. I have performed a side-by-side-by-side-by-side comparison with four other pairs of earbuds and these were the clear winner. Call quality is of secondary importance to me after music reproduction/sound quality - but call clarity and mic response are more than acceptable as well. If you're looking for maximum comfort with above average sound quality, you have a winner here.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful soundstage
customer_reviews.text: The bass is a little *punchy* as opposed to other in ears but my real issues are: 1. The back fell off of one of the drivers the second day I had them. 2. The sound is a bit bright, so much so that I'll get a headache if I'm not careful. (maybe with some burn-in that will resolve) 3. I keep reaching on the right side to answer my phone, when these have the mic on the left. Overall though, at reasonable volume with a high quality recording they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised...excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound and significant comfort. For someone with a neuro-muscular disease and seizure disorder, finding comfort and a sound signature without a level of sibilance that throws me into convulsions is a VERY difficult feat. I'm thrilled with these. I will update this review after I've had more time with them. :) Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: GRG

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with the original Apple iPhone adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT work with the original Apple iPhone adapter. Plain and simple. One channel works and the other is muffled. Tried three different adapters, all Apple original, and all the same thing. Left channel is fine, right channel is faint and muffled.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sooley

customer_reviews.title: Same Old Same Old
customer_reviews.text: These in ear headphones do have very good sound to them ... but I sought a product that would STAY PUT. No matter how nice the device is, if it won't stay in your ear ... You gotta ask ... What For? On the side with the device in line between the ear piece and the Y connector, that one ... always falls out. The accompanying instruction manual sports several languages for the facility of this global market. We are used to that and appreciate it. However, I am also used to seeing English first. This is intended as an objective citation.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Miller

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful vocals and dynamic range
customer_reviews.text: Excellent earphones that incorporates Focal's headphone technology into a remarkably small package. As other reviews have noted, they do require a burn-in period. The clarity of vocals is amazing in comparison to other earphones as well as the dynamic range. They nailed the bass really well - strong bass, but not overbearing. The microphone is also excellent - very clear and does a nice job of filtering out background noise. These are the first pair of earphones I've had that rival full over-the-ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Don M

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great price.
customer_reviews.text: For the past year or so I've been listening to 96/192 FLAC files through a Sony NWZ-A15 powered by a Sony PHA-1A headphone amp powering a pair of ATH-M50x headphones. This combination just seemed to fall short, though some 200 hours of burn-in helped tame most of the shortcomings. The bass is still a little too subtle and the sound stage is a little too confined. Research indicated that the Focal Sphears could eliminate these shortcomings. And they did- with great style. Deep clean bass. Crystal clear highs. Beautiful midrange, breathtaking soundstage. Five Star performance at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: David Green

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality earbud covers and tangle-prone wires
customer_reviews.text: I've used Westone earbuds for years but decided to change it up and tried Focal. Not good quality though. The earbud covers tore easy, and I went through two sets in less than 6 months. The smooth wires were also unexpectedly prone to tangling and resisted de-tangling. Sound was OK, not as good as the Westones, but the other issues led me to abandon them after about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: V. Chu

customer_reviews.title: I felt myself in the concert hall. The depth of sound of this device is the most one for me.
customer_reviews.text: Recently I changed my car speaker with Focal ISS165, and then I am intoxicated to the sound quality. For the same reason, I chose this sphear. The clear high sound, but mid and low sound is good as well. I felt myself in the concert hall. The depth of sound of this device is the most one for me. In addition, it makes me comfortable even when I wear very long time.
customer_reviews.author: SangSoo H.

customer_reviews.title: Highs are too sharp, piercing at times.
customer_reviews.text: The highs are blistering even in HiFi. I gave them an hours long burn-in period and my ears just can't take it. They're actually sore from trying too hard to like them yesterday. I can only imagine the people that can handle a snare drum on these already have damaged hearing, but it's just too much. Some songs sound fine. The bass is pretty great and so are the Mids, which improve after each song, those highs though. They have something to prove and I'm not sure what. I tried adjusting the equalizer on my V30 which has an extremely high quality sound card for HiFi. No dice. Have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Some of the worst sounding headphones I have ever had the displeasure of ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the worst sounding headphones I have ever had the displeasure of wearing. No definition at all at any frequency.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are comfortable and the sound quality is good, however, they broke after 6 months of light use. I took very good care of them, cased them when not being used, and only used them maybe 25 times. Never went through the wash. Regardless, the sound in the left earbud failed after only owning them for 6 months. Other than this I've been pretty happy with the headphones but for the cost they should last longer and be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent headphones, with Mic and come foam/cushion inserts. The price has gone down almost 50% in past month making them a great bargain. Of note, these are not "noise-canceling" headphones--rather, they're just noise-isolating. However with the including foam tips you're bound to get as much ambient noise reduction as you would get with decent quality earplugs (like nrr30 rated). I'd say that's as much as one can ask for. If you need more, you'd have to upgrade to active noise canceling.
customer_reviews.author: e_drisi

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Good sound but very poor construction: 1. The silver metal pieces covering the exterior fell off within 6 months of light use. One one case both pieces fell off, in the second case only one of the silver pieces that forms the exterior fell off (shown). 2. In one of the ear pieces, the griddle covering the mouth of tube that goes into the ear canal fell off. Now the foam inside could just roll into my ear and obstruct my ear canal. I paid $149 for this.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: I am a rabid Audiophile and frankly were disappointed in these
customer_reviews.text: I am a rabid Audiophile and frankly were disappointed in these. Not better in any regard to the Sennheiser, except the sennheiser actually stay in your ear. The addition of a mic weights one cord and this weight always pulls the earpiece out. I would put up with this if the sound were what you expect from Focal. Perhaps too much cost cutting to hit a price point? A solid C+ but not higher.
customer_reviews.author: cerious1

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable Sound for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I own three pairs. The soundstage is wide, the balance is great. Quite simply, these headphones are superior to headphones I've paid more than thrice for (at least at the current price, which I think is a steal). You'll surely get the most out of these with better equipment, but even with routine electronics (i.e., whatever smartphone) you should notice the superiority.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great every day headphones.
customer_reviews.text: They sound nice and work well. I like the little case that comes with them. I keep them in there because if I don't, I wind up with a tangled mess. My only complaint is that they're too big. They don't work well if I'm exercising, they'll fall out of my ears.
customer_reviews.author: HeyMySock

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: No bass. I have had these headphones for a few months now trying to warm up to them but it just isn't happening. There is very little bass compared to my Klipsch earbuds (which I love) and even a $14 pair I picked up at Office Depot one afternoon in desperate need. Not sure if the pair I got were defective when 1st received but now the right earbud is starting to loose sound...awesome. Never buying again.

customer_reviews.title: Danger
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous.....once you listen to these you will not be able to go back to cheap earbuds. Comparable to my shure 1540 over ear headphones which are much more expensive. Do yourself a favour and stop wasting your time on klipsch, Sony, Bose, JL, Beats, Panasonic or skullcandys. For a bit more money (or even less) these are all you need once you get the proper fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound, incredible comfort! These are GREAT in-ear headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are simply wonderful! The most comfortable in-ear 'phones I've ever worn, they boast an open and accurate reproduction of both acoustic and electronic guitar at all sound pressure levels; a lifelike midrange and a rich, deep bass. I've used them daily for the past week, mostly during intensive workouts, and they never have failed to delight. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Beau'sPal

customer_reviews.title: For the money they sound very good but they are not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like the way these sound. But I like to listen to music for long periods of time and these are too big to fit in my ear comfortably. I still listen to them a lot but I will replace them for something more comfortable. But I do like the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Day 1 assessment; Amazing. Ive listened to familiar music and heard tones and sounds that I never knew where there listening through other ear buds, and the high end Bose sound system in my car. The bass is solid, highs and mids are crisp and clean. Im curious to see (hear) if the the sound improves even more based on reviews that indicate the sound will open open even more over time.
customer_reviews.author: IanM

customer_reviews.title: Focal
customer_reviews.text: The Sphears sound very good. Highs are crisp, mids are plenty and the lows are good but not overwhelming. Sound improves after some breaking in, so give time. Thanks to the low impedance they work great with iPhone. These would be perfect if they had a volume control and just a bit more bass. I'm very happy with these and I can't wait for a second generation with a volume control included.
customer_reviews.author: Jarl

customer_reviews.title: These are good
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound quality from these. I don't wear ear buds so i an't speak to their fit but they do come with a bunch of different size and a couple of different types (material) of ear plugs for comfort. i wanted a high quality speaker for my ear so I didn't disturb my room mates and Focal fits the bill!
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money that doesn’t sound like Focal at all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a used pair that was verified “Like New” and got a clearly used product with dirty ear tips, and either the item was defective or damaged, because the sound quality was horrendous! I’ve owned other Focal speakers and headphones, and these did NOT live up to the Focal name!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Slone

customer_reviews.title: The volume on one earpiece is significantly lower than the ...
customer_reviews.text: The volume on one earpiece is significantly lower than the other, which started only 4 months after the purchase date. The warranty has expired and so the product cannot be replaced. It is quite disappointing considering the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, please!!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is worse them $30 pair of earbuds. Don't waste your money on these. I would rate as zero star if possible. The online hype is total bs. Good sound is Shure SH840 followed by Audio-Technica MX50, yes they are over ear headphones not buds, but do you want to enjoy your music or not?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Begemann

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Great
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by the high quality construction and pure spatial sound. I read the reviews on Amazon and from professional reviewers so I took the chance. I was more than happy. Wore them for many hours on a a few long flights. I did not have fatigue, they were incredibly comfortable, and the sound quality blew me away. Clear, true, colored, and nuanced sound. For the price, can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of $90, I bought these because of an online review praising its supposed audio quality and affordability. Barely two weeks go by and the right earbud dies, I had $10 earbuds that have delivered more than what Focal has promised. Buyer beware, always look at the most recent amazon reviews for genuine proof of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected1
customer_reviews.text: Listening to Jason Vieaux play one of Bach's lute partitas on my Sphears as I write this review. The output is from my macbook pro, the source is ITunes, and I use 'boom' for volume and equalization. The sound is clear, immediate and dimensional. I'm impressed! Most importantly, the buds are comfortable - especially with Comply foam tips.
customer_reviews.author: Raybador

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding for about 6 months, then one ear bud just completely died. Only sit on my desk and used at work, so these were not exposed to any hard use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built. Tinny treble.
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds are well made and have a nice fit. The bass is very nice and overall I am enjoying them overall. However, the treble is VERY tinny so I can only give them 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Quinnelly

customer_reviews.title: Just a Great Pair of Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These have been my daily driver for nearly a year with no problem and they've survived the washing/drying cycle. Great sound too, bass sounds good and all. What a good product.
customer_reviews.author: buyerB

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good but these earbuds are veery flimsy. (UPDATE: Now Broken)
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good but these earbuds are veery flimsy. I expect more durability and better materials from a product in this price range. UPDATE: Sound cut out from one side a few months after purchase, very disappointed with this product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Oman

customer_reviews.title: ... and wanted some high quality ear buds that sound great and are comfortable for 4-5 hour flights
customer_reviews.text: I am starting to travel more these days and wanted some high quality ear buds that sound great and are comfortable for 4-5 hour flights. These hit the spot, great sound, very comfortable and easy to carry around, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: SHL1

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality not worth the price; failed after a year
customer_reviews.text: I'm no sound expert, but I just didn't find that this listening experience was markedly different from a $25 set of earbuds. I read some reviews noting that the bass improves over time, but never came through on mine. After 15 months, there is no sound coming through one of the two earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: paul steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Highs are too pronounced.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed with these. The highs are so hot that listening to anything with silibance is painful. After burning them in for 8 hours the edge was taken off, but they still have a major bump around 8-12k that makes listening fatiguing and unpleasant. It's a shame, because theyes would otherwise be beating out headphones double their price. Mids, lows are clean and clear, the imaging is excellent, and accuracy is superb. Fit is fine- in-ears are never going to fit everybody. If Focal can update these and take care of those highs they'll have a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but pricey and a bit unwieldy for public ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but pricey and a bit unwieldy for public use. Plug bent shortly after upgrading to iPhone 8s when having to use adapter cord. Clearly a substandard but very light metal was used.
customer_reviews.author: J-Ro

customer_reviews.title: Worth twice the price
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with these ear buds. I hear textures and nuances that simply aren't there in lesser phones. I've found myself just sitting on my couch and listening to music so much more. What a joy. Remember to turn your music quality to "extreme" if using Spotify!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D Eastwick

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but clear sound
customer_reviews.text: Honestly pretty disappointed. The large driver doesn't like to stay in ear. The foam noise canceling attachments do not last. I had to EQ the hell out of these to get any mid-bass and midrange out of them. All highs.
customer_reviews.author: ryan.pitt

customer_reviews.title: Ok earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds sound was great. The ear pieces that came from the factory were not any good. Had to bum of the ear pieces from my beats earbuds to let it securely rest in my ear. Just recently the insulation on the right earbud cracked. Very disappointed. Then the review is asking haw the volume control on the earbuds are. There is no volume control. Just a mic.
customer_reviews.author: wraywrey

customer_reviews.title: Sound great but went through 2 pairs in a month.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pairs for my teenage kids for Christmas. One pair still holding up, the other was sent back and replacement started acting the same within a couple of weeks. The sound volume decreased noticeably and one channel became softer than the other.
customer_reviews.author: S Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Clear and balanced
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones - balanced sound, clear. The microphone and controls work well with Android devices and Xbox One controllers. I prefer the foam buds. For the price I paid, I am amazed at the sound. They arrived quickly and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: plautus001

customer_reviews.title: Next Level Sound
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound quality. No boosted bass that I can hear. Can't recommend highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit, so doesn't sound good
customer_reviews.text: Even with the multiple buds that come with the product, the fit for me is very poor. So the sound is tinny, awful. I contacted a distributor, the seller through Amazon and Focal...no one has a solution. The product is worthless to me. Lesson learned: If you don't think it fits, send it back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: FWorld

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality with zero support
customer_reviews.text: The right earpiece driver became detached and now rattles around with the music. I called the local focal retailer and I was told “if I did not buy it there, they would not help me”. Emailed focal HQ multiple times to no response. These failed 37 days after purchase. I feel like this product is a bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: ScottyR

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're getting
customer_reviews.text: All my vehicles have focal Speakers , in my opinion there's nothing better than focal.
customer_reviews.author: larry m

customer_reviews.title: one side no longer works
customer_reviews.text: I just want something dependable I loved the case and carefully replaced them after each use still only got about a years worth out of them
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Imsdahl

customer_reviews.title: really nicely done
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality from lows to highs, and the mids inbetween. Very comfortable. Not a complete seal, which I like, since earphones that hermetically seal make me feel like I'm under water. Mic is close to your mouth. Controls are down where they are easy to grab. Looks great. Only negative is no volume control...I'm guessing because the same unit works for iPhones and Android.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Bortner

customer_reviews.title: Fun sounding earphones
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars only because the foam tips include are of terrible quality. I purchased some comply tips afterwards and expect those to be of higher quality. Although I do not get the greatest isolation even with these tips. The earphones are more fun that the analytical high-end phones available out there for the same price or more expensive. Happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these! the sound is rich and clear. Very well balanced and they stay in your ears pretty well. Not sure if I would use these for any sports activities though, feels like they may fall out because the buds are a little heavier, but for being out and about they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Mango

customer_reviews.title: Left Ear Bud Died
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year of occasional use, the left ear bud gave out. I expect that from $10 Walmart headphones, hoped for better with a pair of $150 headphones. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Better than my last few buds.
customer_reviews.text: At last a step up, but will they be durable?
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best pair i have ever owned!!
customer_reviews.text: These the best pair I have ever owned and sound so good!! I returned Sennheiser Momentum and kept this. Sennheiser Momentum is no where close to Focal in terms of sound quality and comfort. These are very light and stays in my ear and I can wear it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Great cable material does not allow entanglement
customer_reviews.text: Are not completely compatible with iPhone 6s Plus and does not allow volume control from the headphones themselves. Great cable material does not allow entanglement.
customer_reviews.author: MFPBJ

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow these are the best headphones ever I literally jumped out of my seat ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow these are the best headphones ever I literally jumped out of my seat because these reproduce music the way it was ment to be heard it's like being there live.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sound!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 13 yr old after reading a review on C-NET. He said they fit well and have amazing sound quality. He's had them 6 months and they still work great.
customer_reviews.author: SVW

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is true. These headphones are not for people who want bass heavy sound. Focal makes world class speakers.
customer_reviews.author: choc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy headphones with great sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great for the value. They are also very resilient. By that I mean my headphones usually break after having them this long, so I was surprised they have held up.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Left ear stopped working after a few months, only buy if you are looking for headphones for the very short-term
customer_reviews.text: Sound in the left ear stopped working after about four months. For the price, wasn't happy about that. Audio quality is fine, but nothing special. Also it's a shame that there are no volume controls on the chord, only the play/stop button. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Plotner

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best Universal IEMs
customer_reviews.text: These are simply the best Universal-fit IEMs I've ever tried. They have an amazing sound stage that makes them punch far above their pricepoint.
customer_reviews.author: bergauk

customer_reviews.title: Get these.
customer_reviews.text: Agreed with a number of other reviewers that these take a bit of time to warm up, but they are utterly delightful. Rich, full sound. No muddiness. Crisp highs and deep lows. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Green

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Listenning music at work from the computer. This product doesn't have a remote control for sound.
customer_reviews.author: Yohann A

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several sets of Focals in a past vehicles (polyglass and Kevlar) and enjoy the Focal sound. These earbuds are comfortable and sound great. One side stopped working and Focal customer support quickly replaced them at no charge. They easily follow me from work to the gym to mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have great sound and stay in the ear very well. Quality construction so they should last.
customer_reviews.author: Ron M

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Used them a handful of times and the left earbud sounds muted. Pretty much useless. Very costly mistake.
customer_reviews.author: mompreneur

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sibilant
customer_reviews.text: After hearing just a few songs with these, I had to stop using them. The headphones are extremely sibilant and go nuts every time an 's' is sung.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Song

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Sound great. Could use a little more bass at times. Immediately noticed the difference in these when compared to my old headphones. Sometimes they aren't very loud but really good headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Cable Noise
customer_reviews.text: Had to return these. Very upsetting. These in-ears have excellent sound but the cable noise is horrible. They sound great sitting on the train or subway but then you get up and handling noise is all you hear. Making it worse is the length of the cable and the placement of the remote. It hangs low on the chest with no adjustment. As you walk the remote flops around, hitting your chest and sending even more noise through the cable. It's real shame. These are some of the better in-ears that I've used but poor cable design kills an otherwise great set especially for the audiophile/enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sonnenfeld

customer_reviews.title: the best headphone for priced $100
customer_reviews.text: this item has good built quality, the sound is very clear and amazing when listening to music, but you should learn that after one month's trying at least. BTW, the call quality is very good too. very happy to get it
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: If you love Music buy these Now!
customer_reviews.text: Ears Up! Hands Down! Focal Sphear earbuds are the best in ears I have ever owned or sonically experienced! I use the Neutron Music player Audiophile App on my Galaxy S phone. The combination of the earbuds and the app MUST BE HEARD TO BE BELIEVED! Just Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Cbreezy

customer_reviews.title: Broke very quickly
customer_reviews.text: The right earbud went super quiet after <20 uses. They don't have a customer service or return page on their website. Looks like I just threw out $70
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, not to flat or to much bass. Comfortable fit. I like the L shaped jack that plugs into the phone. I feel like it puts less stress on the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Simply George and Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful full sound, had some trouble with some devices recognizing volume control, but cannot tell if it was the headphones or the computer/phone. Buy these if you want simple functionality and great audio.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Colton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality, bass may be weak for some people but I listen primarily classical music. Also, a bit disappointed that it doesn't have volume control. Works well on both iphone and galaxy.
customer_reviews.author: Honda NSX

customer_reviews.title: Washed in My Pants. Still Work!
customer_reviews.text: I am writing a review to express how great they are. Had many in ears, beats, monster, bowers/wilkins c5 s2, these crush all those. Plus my fiance accidentally washed them and dried them and they still worked. That was a massive shock. Been using them for months now with no side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Graham

customer_reviews.title: You HAVE to get these!
customer_reviews.text: Best ear buds EVER! I hear parr’s of songs I never knew existed! Highly recommended!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Carr

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great...but the headphones broke after a few weeks. Sound in one ear became much lower than the other.
customer_reviews.author: AstroDev

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality, Comfortable Fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair to replace my Shures that didn't survive the washing machine. At half the price of the Shures I was very happy with the sound quality. Also, they fit more comfortably that the other earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Dean F.

customer_reviews.title: Bought these as a gift for my niece and she loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my niece and she loves them! She is a dancer and runs and they work well in this environment. She said sound is awesome. She had never had a high-end pair of earbuds so she is really happy.
customer_reviews.author: LSU.Tiger Too

customer_reviews.title: Best around price point, if your audiophile you like these!
customer_reviews.text: After a year I'm still impressed with these ear buds, Then I bought my brother a pair for Christmas! Definitely made for audiophiles! 👍
customer_reviews.author: deemaudio

product_meta.title: Focal Sphear S High Definition Earphones - Black
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:Black

Enjoy Focal sound wherever you are with the Sphear S in-ear headphones. The ultra-large Mylar transducers (10.8mm), one of the biggest of their type, ensure an extended frequency response in the low end as well as a remarkable tonal balance. Designed to suit all ear shapes and sizes, Sphear S provides noise isolation and ensures and optimal audio experience in complete comfort, even during prolonged listening.



BOX CONTAINS
1 x Sphear S earphones; 3 silicone tips (sizes S/M/L); 3 memory foam tips (sizes S/M/L); 1 carrying case
feature_bullets: Large electro-dynamic drivers for a remarkable sound neutrality
Compatible with all types of devices (smartphones, tablets, MP3 player, computers)
Universal remote control for controlling music and phone calls
Delivered with a full kit of accessories (carrying case, tips...)
Impedance is 10 ohm. Sensitivity is 103 decibels. Frequency response is 20 hertz to 20 kilohertz

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
